intro.description: This cheat sheet helps you to open an image, and shows you how to use the cross-hair profile tool with the file. If you have just completed the previous cheat sheet, please close all your data file parts.

item.title: Data Browsing Perspective
item.description: Please choose the data browsing perspective if you do not already have it selected (nothing will happen if you do not).

item.title: Open File
item.description: Click to open an example file from the 'data' project containing a test image.

item.title: Select 'Cross Hair Profile' tool
item.description: Select the 'Cross Hair Profile' tool from the toolbar above the plot, tools labelled 'Image tools used to profile and inspect images'. These tools may be obscured on Linux if the window containing the plot is too small.

item.title: Move cursor around
item.description: Move the cursor around over the image. In the 'Cross Hair Profile' view you will see the vertical and horizontal profile (intensity values in x and y).

item.title: Click and clear
item.description: Now click a few locations in the image. Each time you click the profile is saved. In the toolbar of the 'Cross Hair Profile' tool there is an action which looks like two graph axes labelled 'Clear cross hair profiles'. Click this to remove the save profiles.
item.onCompletion: Congratulations, you can now use cross hair profiles with images. Try with your images. NOTE: If you use the masking tool, you can mask out pixels with unwanted intensity values and this profile tool will use the mask.
